events.originalText: NASA launched the Mars Science Laboratory mission from Cape Canaveral, carrying the Curiosity rover onboard.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA Launches Mars Science Laboratory Mission from Cape Canaveral with Curiosity Rover

events.originalText: In a friendly-fire incident, a skirmish occurred between U.S.-led NATO forces and Pakistani security forces at two military checkposts along the Afghanistan–Pakistan border.
events.subtitle: Friendly fire
events.headline: Skirmish Erupts Between U.S.-led NATO Forces and Pakistani Security Forces at Afghanistan–Pakistan Border

events.originalText: A coordinated group of shooting and bombing attacks across Mumbai began, ultimately killing at least 174 people and wounding more than 300 others.
events.subtitle: 2008 Mumbai attacks
events.headline: Coordinated Attacks in Mumbai Leave 174 Dead and Over 300 Injured

events.originalText: Six robbers broke into a Brink's-Mat warehouse at Heathrow Airport in London and stole £26 million in gold, diamonds and cash.
events.subtitle: Brink's
events.headline: Robbers Steal £26 Million in Gold, Diamonds, and Cash from Brink's-Mat Warehouse at Heathrow Airport

events.originalText: A speaker claiming to represent the "Intergalactic Association" interrupted a Southern Television broadcast in South East England.
events.subtitle: Southern Television broadcast interruption
events.headline: Speaker Interrupts Southern Television Broadcast in South East England Claiming to Represent 'Intergalactic Association'

events.originalText: World War II: Josip Broz Tito and the Yugoslav Partisans convened the first meeting of the Anti-Fascist Council for the National Liberation of Yugoslavia at Bihać in northwestern Bosnia.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Yugoslav Partisans Convene First Meeting of Anti-Fascist Council for National Liberation of Yugoslavia at Bihać

events.originalText: Casablanca, starring Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman, premiered at the Hollywood Theatre in New York City to coincide with the Allied invasion of French North Africa and the capture of Casablanca.
events.subtitle: Casablanca (film)
events.headline: Casablanca Premieres in New York City as Allied Invasion of French North Africa Begins

events.originalText: The Iron Guard killed 64 political detainees at a penitentiary near Bucharest and followed up with several high-profile assassinations, including that of former Romanian prime minister Nicolae Iorga.
events.subtitle: Iron Guard
events.headline: Iron Guard Kills 64 Political Detainees Near Bucharest and Assassinates Former Romanian Prime Minister

events.originalText: The Soviet Red Army shelled the village of Mainila and then claimed that the fire originated from Finland, giving them a casus belli to launch the Winter War a few days later.
events.subtitle: Red Army
events.headline: Soviet Red Army Shells Mainila, Claims Fire Originated from Finland, Leading to Winter War

events.originalText: A large internal explosion destroyed HMS Bulwark near Sheerness, killing 741 people on board.
events.subtitle: HMS Bulwark (1899)
events.headline: HMS Bulwark Destroyed by Internal Explosion Near Sheerness, 741 Killed

events.originalText: A massive earthquake struck the Dutch East Indies, creating a tsunami that washed away villages, ships and residents.
events.subtitle: 1852 Banda Sea earthquake
events.headline: Massive Earthquake in Dutch East Indies Triggers Devastating Tsunami

events.originalText: The French navy bombarded Salé, Morocco (pictured), damaging the city's infrastructure and its Great Mosque.
events.subtitle: Bombardment of Salé
events.headline: French Navy Bombards Salé, Morocco, Damaging City's Infrastructure and Great Mosque

events.originalText: The University of Notre Dame (main building pictured) was founded by Edward Sorin of the Congregation of Holy Cross as an all-male institution in the U.S. state of Indiana.
events.subtitle: University of Notre Dame
events.headline: University of Notre Dame Founded by Edward Sorin in Indiana as All-Male Institution

events.originalText: Texas Revolution: Texian forces attacked a Mexican pack train, capturing 40 saddlebags of grass.
events.subtitle: Texas Revolution
events.headline: Texian Forces Capture 40 Saddlebags of Grass in Attack on Mexican Pack Train
